metadata.Title: CVE-2022-38533 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In GNU Binutils before 2.40, there is a heap-buffer-overflow in the error function bfd_getl32 when called from the strip_main function in strip-new via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-38533` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.8
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.8
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.8

notes.Note: seth-arnold> binutils isn't safe for untrusted inputs.

criterions.comment: binutils package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.8').
